sect1:
Map Commands MGET, MGETALL, MPUT, MTRYPUT, MSET, MPUTTRANSIENT, MPUTANDUNLOCK, MREMOVE, MREMOVEITEM, MCONTAINSKEY, MCONTAINSVALUE, ADDLISTENER, EVENT, REMOVELISTENER, KEYSET, ENTRYSET, MGETENTRY, MLOCK, MISKEYLOCKED, MUNLOCK, MLOCKMAP, MUNLOCKMAP, MFORCEUNLOCK, MPUTALL, MPUTIFABSENT, MREMOVEIFSAME, MREPLACEIFNOTNULL, MREPLACEIFSAME, MTRYLOCKANDGET, MFLUSH, MEVICT, MADDLISTENER, MREMOVELISTENER
MPUT
Associates the specified value with the specified key in the map. If the map previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced by the specified value. The operation will return the old value.
COMMAND:
MPUT <name> [ttl] [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
ttl is optional parameter in milliseconds. If set, the entry will be evicted after ttl milliseconds.
Return value:
OK #1 <size of old_value in bytes> <old_value in bytes>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. If no old value exists it will return OK. Note that if the key is locked by another thread then the operation will be blocked until the key is unlocked.
MPUTTRANSIENT
Associates the specified value with the specified key in the map. If the map previously contained a mapping for this key, the old value is replaced by the specified value. This command is exactly the same as MPUT, the only difference is that it want trigger Map Store if defined and will not return the old value.
COMMAND:
MPUTTRANSIENT <name> <ttl> [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
ttl is in milliseconds. If set, the entry will be evicted after ttl milliseconds. If 0, it will leave forever.
Return value:
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return OK. Note that if the key is locked by another thread then the operation will be blocked until the key is unlocked.
MSIZE
Returns the size of the map.
COMMAND:
MSIZE <name>
Return value:
OK <size>
MSET
Puts an entry into this map with a given ttl (time to live) value. Entry will expire and get evicted after the ttl. If ttl is 0, then the entry lives forever. Similar to MPUT command except that set doesn't return the old value which is more efficient.
COMMAND:
MSET <name> <ttl> [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
ttl is in milliseconds. If set, the entry will be evicted after ttl milliseconds.
Return value:
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return OK. Note that if the key is locked by another thread then the operation will be blocked until the key is unlocked.
MTRYPUT
Tries to put the given key, value into this map within specified timeout value. If this method returns false, it means that the caller thread couldn't acquire the lock for the key within timeout duration, thus put operation is not successful.
COMMAND:
MTRYPUT <name> <timeout> #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
timeout is in milliseconds.
Return value:
OK <true or false>
MPUTALL
Copies all of the mappings from the specified map to this map. The effect of this call is equivalent to that of calling MPUT k v on this map once for each mapping from key k to value v in the specified map but MPUTALL will be much faster as it combines all the keys that belong to certain member and performs bulk operation per member.
COMMAND:
MPUTALL <name> [noreply] #2N <size of key1> <size of value1> … <size of keyN> <size of valueN> <key1 in bytes> <value1 in bytes> … <keyN in bytes> <valueN in bytes>
Return value:
Will return OK. Note that if one of the keys is locked by another thread then the operation will be blocked until all the keys are unlocked.
MPUTANDUNLOCK
Puts the key and value into this map and unlocks the key if the calling thread owns the lock.
COMMAND:
MPUTANDUNLOCK <name> [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
Return value:
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return OK.
MTRYLOCKANDGET
Tries to acquire the lock for the specified key and returns the value of the key if lock is required in time. If the lock is not available then the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until one of two things happens: The lock is acquired by the current thread; or The specified waiting time elapses.
COMMAND:
MPUTANDUNLOCK <name> <timeout> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
MGET
Returns the value to which this map maps the specified key. Returns null if the map contains no mapping for this key.
COMMAND:
MGET <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
if value is null then OK will return. Meaning that there is no value to return.
MGETALL
Returns the entries for the given keys.
COMMAND:
MGETALL <name> #N <size of key1 in bytes> ... <size of keyN in bytes> <key1 in bytes> ... <keyN in bytes>
Return value:
OK #N <size of value1 in bytes> ... <size of valueN in bytes> <value1 in bytes> ... <valueN in bytes>
Note that if the particular value for particular key is null, then the size for that value will return as zero.
MREMOVE
Removes the mapping for this key from this map if it is present
COMMAND:
MREMOVE <name> [noreply] #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
if value is null then OK will return. Meaning that there is no value to return.
MTRYREMOVE
Tries to remove the entry with the given key from this map within specified timeout value. If the key is already locked by another thread and/or member, then this operation will wait timeout amount for acquiring the lock.
COMMAND:
MTRYREMOVE <name> <timeout> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
timeout is in milliseconds.
Return value:
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
if the remove is not successful within specified timeout the following response will be returned
OK timeout
MGETENTRY
Returns the entry statistics and value for a given key.
COMMAND:
MGETENTRY <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK <costinbytes> <creationtime> <expirationtime> <hits> <lastaccesstime> <laststoredtime> <lastupdatetime> <version> <isvalid> #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
if value is null then just OK will be returned. The time values are long representation of java Date values.
KEYSET
Returns keys of the map.
COMMAND:
KEYSET <type> <name>
Return value:
OK #N <key1 length> ... <keyN length> <key1 in bytes>...<keyN in bytes>
MLOCK
Acquires the lock for the specified key. If the lock is not available then the call is scheduled and waits until the lock has been acquired. Scope of the lock is this map only. Acquired lock is only for the key in this map. Locks are re-entrant so if the key is locked N times then it should be unlocked N times before another thread can acquire it.
COMMAND:
MLOCK <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK
MUNLOCK
Releases the lock for the specified key. It never blocks and returns immediately.
If the current thread is the holder of this lock then the hold count is decremented. If the hold count is now zero then the lock is released. If the current thread is not the holder of this lock then {@link IllegalMonitorStateException} is thrown.
COMMAND:
MUNLOCK <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK
MTRYLOCK
Tries to acquire the lock for the specified key. If the lock is not available then the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until one of two things happens:
The lock is acquired by the current thread; or The specified waiting time elapses
COMMAND:
MTRYLOCK <name> <timeout> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
0 timeout means don't wait.
Return value:
OK <isacquired?>
MISKEYLOCKED
Checks the lock for the specified key. If the lock is acquired then returns true, else false.
COMMAND:
MISKEYLOCKED <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK <isLocked?>
MLOCKMAP
Tries to acquire the lock for the entire map. The thread that locks the map can do all the operations but other threads in the cluster cannot operate on the map.
If the lock is not available then the operation waits until one of two things happens:
The lock is acquired by the current thread; or The specified waiting time elapses
COMMAND:
MLOCKMAP <name> <timeout>
Return value:
OK <isLocked?>
MUNLOCKMAP
Unlocks the map. It never blocks and returns immediately.
COMMAND:
MUNLOCKMAP <name> <timeout>
Return value:
OK
MFORCEUNLOCK
Releases the lock for the specified key regardless of the lock owner. It always successfully unlocks the key, never blocks and returns immediately.
COMMAND:
MFORCEUNLOCK <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK
MCONTAINSKEY
Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the specified key.
COMMAND:
MCONTAINSKEY <name> #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
Return value:
OK <contans?>
MCONTAINSVALUE
Returns true if this map maps one or more keys to the specified value.
COMMAND:
MCONTAINSKEY <name> #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
Return value:
OK <contans?>
MPUTIFABSENT
If the specified key is not already associated with a value, associate it with the given value.
COMMAND:
MPUTIFABSENT <name> [ttl] [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
ttl is optional parameter in milliseconds. If set, the entry will be evicted after ttl milliseconds.
Return value:
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return value to be associated with the specified key.
MREMOVEIFSAME
Removes the entry for a key only if currently mapped to a given value
COMMAND:
MREMOVEIFSAME <name> [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
Return value:
OK <isRemoved?>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return true if entry is removed.
MREPLACEIFNOTNULL
Replaces the entry for a key only if currently mapped to some value..
COMMAND:
MREPLACEIFNOTNULL <name> [noreply] #2 <size of key in bytes> <size of value in bytes> <key in bytes><value in bytes>
Return value:
OK #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return value to be associated with the specified key.
MREPLACEIFSAME
Replaces the entry for a key only if currently mapped to a given value. This is equivalent to
if (map.containsKey(key) && map.get(key).equals(oldValue)) { map.put(key, newValue); return true; } else return false;
COMMAND:
MREPLACEIFSAME <name> [noreply] #3 <size of key in bytes> <size of old_value in bytes> <size of new_value in bytes> <key in bytes><old_value in bytes><new_value in bytes>
Return value:
OK <isReplaced?>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return true if the value was replaced.
MFLUSH
If this map has a MapStore and write-delay-seconds is bigger than 0 (write-behind) then this method flushes all the local dirty entries by calling MapStore.storeAll()
COMMAND:
MFLUSH <name> [noreply]
Return value:
OK
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return OK.
MEVICT
Evicts the specified key from this map. If MapStore defined for this map, then the entry is not deleted from the underlying MapStore, evict only removes the entry from the memory.
COMMAND:
MEVICT <name> [noreply] #1 <size of value in bytes> <value in bytes>
Return value:
OK <evicted?>
If noreply is provided, server will not return a response. Otherwise it will return true if evicted..
MADDLISTENER
Adds an entry listener for this map. Listener will get notified for all map add/remove/update/evict events.
COMMAND:
MADDLISTENER <name> <includevalue> [noreply] #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
providing key is optional. If provided the listener will be notified only for the key, otherwise it will be notified for all entries in the map.
Return value:
OK will return.
EVENT
After adding the listener. The following events will be received from the server.
EVENT:
EVENT <type> <name> <eventType> #3 <size of key> <size of newvalue in bytes> <size of oldValue in bytes> <key in bytes> <newvalue in bytes><oldvalue in bytes>
eventype is one of the following: ADDED, REMOVED, UPDATED, EVICTED. Depending on the event type, only one value may be returned from the server. Two values will be returned only in the UPDATED case.
MREMOVELISTENER
Adds an entry listener for this map. Listener will get notified for all map add/remove/update/evict events.
COMMAND:
MREMOVELISTENER <name> [noreply] #1 <size of key in bytes> <key in bytes>
providing key is optional. If provided the listener will be stopped to receive events only for the key, otherwise it will stop to receive for all entries in the map.
Return value:
OK will return.
MADDINDEX
Add's index to the map. Index attribute should either have a getter method or be public. You should also make sure to add the indexes before adding entries to this map.
COMMAND:
MADDINDEX <name> <attribute> <ordered?> [noreply]
add's index to the specified attribute. ordered should be set true if the index will be ordered?
Return value:
OK will return.
